instruction: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: As-salamu alaikum. Stop ordering Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani from restaurants now. What's the need when you can make delicious, authentic Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani at home? It’s very easy to make.

You’re going to love it a lot. Let’s start making Hyderabadi Biryani. To make Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani, first we need 1 kg of chicken. You can keep the chicken pieces either large or medium in size.

instruction: Add chicken pieces to the marinade along with green chilies, half of the mint and coriander leaves. Mix thoroughly and cover. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
title: Marinate Chicken

transcript_segments.text: A little more than half a teaspoon of crushed green chilies – you can finely chop or crush them coarsely. Add 2 teaspoons of salt, and juice of one lemon. Add 4 tablespoons full of—

Fresh coriander and mint leaves—wash them well and add. 1 tablespoon of garam masala powder. This is Hyderabadi garam masala powder. You’ll find the link in the description box. Just type Hyderabadi G—

instruction: Thinly slice the onions. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat and fry the onions in batches until golden brown and crispy.
title: Slice and Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 cup of oil. This is the same oil in which we fried the onions. We are also going to add fried onions now—birista. Now mix everything well. It’s mixed properly. Now we’ll add the fried onions too—

instruction: Remove fried onions and place on paper towels to absorb excess oil. Set aside half for layering later.
title: Drain Fried Onions

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 cup of oil. This is the same oil in which we fried the onions. We are also going to add fried onions now—birista. Now mix everything well. It’s mixed properly. Now we’ll add the fried onions too—

instruction: Mix the remaining half of the fried onions into the marinated chicken.
title: Add Onions to Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 cup of oil. This is the same oil in which we fried the onions. We are also going to add fried onions now—birista. Now mix everything well. It’s mixed properly. Now we’ll add the fried onions too—

Take half a cup of milk, add 2 to 3 pinches of saffron in it. Add this as well. If you don’t have saffron, just add plain milk. Add 1 teaspoon of cardamom powder. If you don’t have powder, crush 4–5 cardamoms and add.
All the ingredients have mixed well with the chicken. Cover it with a lid and let it marinate for 2 hours. You can also marinate it for 3 or 4 hours, or even overnight in the refrigerator.

instruction: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
title: Rinse and Soak Rice

transcript_segments.text: Meanwhile, soak 1 kg of basmati rice for one hour. Our chicken has marinated well and the rice is soaked. Now let’s start preparing to boil the rice. For that, take a large pot—

instruction: Warm the milk slightly and add saffron strands. Let it sit for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.
title: Prepare Saffron Milk

transcript_segments.text: Meanwhile, soak 1 kg of basmati rice for one hour. Our chicken has marinated well and the rice is soaked. Now let’s start preparing to boil the rice. For that, take a large pot—

instruction: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon, star anise, peppercorns).
title: Boil Water with Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Add some chopped coriander and mint leaves like this. Now add garam masala powder—a little less than 1 teaspoon. 2 to 3 small cinnamon sticks, 4 to 5 cloves, cardamom, and about a teaspoon of shahi jeera—
This gives a nice aroma to the rice. Juice of half a lemon. Add 2 tablespoons of oil. Mix everything well. Once the water starts boiling, we will add the rice.

instruction: Drain soaked rice and add it to the boiling spiced water. Cook until the rice is 70% done—grains should still be slightly firm. Drain the rice immediately.
title: Parboil the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Let it boil for a minute like this so the spices release their flavor into the water. After adding the rice, mix once or twice gently. Keep the flame on high while the rice is cooking. Now I’ll tell you the timing—

Boil the rice for only 3 minutes. After boiling, we’re going to make the first layer of biryani over the chicken. Look, the water now—we’ll take a little of it. The chicken is absorbing the flavors. Three minutes are done.

instruction: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spread the marinated chicken evenly as the bottom layer.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: Boil the rice for only 3 minutes. After boiling, we’re going to make the first layer of biryani over the chicken. Look, the water now—we’ll take a little of it. The chicken is absorbing the flavors. Three minutes are done.

instruction: Spread the parboiled rice evenly over the chicken layer.
title: Layer the Rice

transcript_segments.text: Now let’s make the first layer of biryani. Strain the rice properly and layer it over the chicken.

After making the first layer, we’ll boil the rice again for 2 to 3 minutes for the second layer. Two to three minutes are done. Add the second layer. Spread it out evenly. Mix a bit of orange food color in milk—

instruction: Top with the reserved fried onions, remaining mint and coriander leaves, saffron milk, and drizzle with ghee.
title: Add Final Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: You can also add yellow food color. Add a little ghee—3 teaspoons. Fresh coriander and mint leaves. Now seal the vessel—with aluminum foil or a cotton cloth. To seal it well, place an old tawa (griddle) below.

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or seal the edges with dough to trap steam inside.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: You can also add yellow food color. Add a little ghee—3 teaspoons. Fresh coriander and mint leaves. Now seal the vessel—with aluminum foil or a cotton cloth. To seal it well, place an old tawa (griddle) below.

instruction: Place the sealed pot on high heat for 5 minutes. Then reduce to very low heat and let cook (dum) for 25–30 minutes.
title: Cook on High and Low Heat

transcript_segments.text: Cook on high flame for 2–3 minutes. After that, lower the flame and let it cook on "dum" (steam) for 30–40 minutes. Two to three minutes have passed, now we’ll lower the flame. We’ll steam it for 30–40 minutes.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani sit for 10 minutes to settle and absorb flavors.
title: Rest the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: Hot chicken biryani is ready!

instruction: Gently fluff the rice with a flat spoon without breaking the grains. Serve hot with raita, salad, or mirchi ka salan.
title: Serve
